title: Peter parker bruce banner clark kent
excerpt: Lots of superheroes have alliterative names (names that use the same initial letter or sound for both their first and last name).

children.text: Lots of superheroes have alliterative names (names that use the same initial letter or sound for both their first and last name).
They also have alter egos, complex backstories, and superhuman powers or skills.
But that’s not what makes them a hero.
It’s standing up for what’s right, making sacrifices for the greater good.
Being a leader without a title. Inspiring others through their actions rather than words.
Heroes aren’t defined by their powers. They’re defined by their choices; by their courage.
